## Geplanten Versand verwalten

## Automatische Erinnerungen

# Set Up Scheduled Distribution

Instead of sending your press release immediately, you can schedule distribution for a later time. CeleroPress will then send the emails automatically at the chosen time.

## Why Use Scheduled Distribution?

**Optimal Send Time:**
- Send **Tuesday to Thursday, 09:00-11:00 AM** when journalists read their emails
- Reach international contacts at the **right time of day** in their timezone
- Avoid bad times (Monday morning, Friday afternoon, weekends)

**Flexibility:**
- Prepare press releases **outside working hours** (e.g., Sunday evening)
- Send next morning at optimal time
- You don't need to be online when distribution starts

**Embargo Deadlines:**
- Clients often have **embargo periods** (e.g., "Do not publish before January 15")
- Schedule distribution exactly for embargo end time
- Automatic distribution guarantees punctuality

**Coordination:**
- Send **multiple press releases** in coordinated timing
- Example: Product launch with multiple announcements at different times

## When Should You Send Immediately?

- **Breaking News**: Breaking news or time-critical topics
- **Reactive PR**: Response to current events
- **You're Online**: You want to monitor distribution directly

## Step-by-Step Guide

### Step 1: Prepare Distribution

1. Open your project
2. Switch to **"Press Release"** tab
3. Click **"Prepare Distribution"**
4. Go through the 3 steps of the email composer:
   - Step 1: Review content
   - Step 2: Configure recipients and sender
   - Step 3: Preview

[Screenshot: Email composer with 3 steps]

### Step 2: Choose "Schedule Distribution"

In the last step (Step 3: Preview) you have two buttons:

- **"Send Now"** ‚Üí Immediate distribution
- **"Schedule Distribution"** ‚Üí Scheduled distribution

Click **"Schedule Distribution"**.

[Screenshot: "Schedule Distribution" button]

### Step 3: Choose Date and Time

A **calendar modal** opens:

#### Select Date

1. **Calendar View**: Current month is displayed
2. **Navigation**: Use arrows (< >) to switch between months
3. **Choose Date**: Click on desired day

**Restrictions:**
- **Earliest**: Tomorrow (not today)
- **Latest**: 90 days in the future
- **Past Days**: Are grayed out and not selectable

#### Set Time

**Format**: 24-hour format (e.g., 14:30)

**Input:**
- **Hour**: Dropdown with 00-23
- **Minute**: Dropdown with 00, 15, 30, 45 (or manual input for exact minutes)

**Example:**
```
Date: Tuesday, January 15, 2026
Time: 10:00 AM
```

#### Time Zone

- **Automatic**: Your local time zone is used automatically
- **Display**: "CET" (Central European Time) or your account timezone
- **Note**: Time zone cannot be changed (always uses your account timezone)

**Countdown:**

The modal shows when distribution will occur:

```
Distribution in: 2 days, 14 hours, 32 minutes
```

[Screenshot: Calendar modal with date/time selection]

### Step 4: Schedule Distribution

1. Check date and time again
2. Click **"Schedule Distribution"**
3. A confirmation dialog appears:

```
Schedule Distribution?

Your press release will be sent on 01/15/2026 at 10:00 AM (CET)
to 142 recipients.

You can cancel distribution until 09:55 AM.

[Cancel]  [Schedule Now]
```

4. Click **"Schedule Now"**

### Step 5: Confirmation

After scheduling, you see a success message:

```
Distribution scheduled! ‚úÖ

Your press release will be sent on 01/15/2026 at 10:00 AM
to 142 recipients.

You'll receive a reminder 30 minutes before.
```

You're automatically redirected to the **monitoring dashboard**.

## Manage Scheduled Distribution

### View Scheduled Distribution

1. Go to **Project ‚Üí Monitoring**
2. Select your press release
3. In the **header** you see:

```
üìÖ Scheduled Distribution: 01/15/2026, 10:00 AM (in 2 days)
```

**Status Badge:**
- üü° **"Scheduled"** ‚Üí Distribution is scheduled
- üîµ **"In 24h"** ‚Üí Distribution in less than 24 hours
- üü¢ **"Running"** ‚Üí Distribution is currently in progress
- ‚úÖ **"Completed"** ‚Üí Distribution was successfully completed

[Screenshot: Monitoring view with scheduled distribution]

### Edit Scheduled Distribution

**To change date/time:**

1. Click **"Edit"** (next to distribution date)
2. Calendar modal opens again
3. Choose new date and/or new time
4. Click **"Save Changes"**

**Restriction:**
- Changes only possible up to **5 minutes before send time**
- After that, distribution is "locked" and cannot be changed

### Cancel Scheduled Distribution

**Cancel distribution completely:**

1. Click **"Cancel Distribution"** (red button)
2. A confirmation dialog appears:

```
Cancel Distribution?

The scheduled distribution will be deleted.
You can reschedule it later.

[Back]  [Yes, Cancel]
```

3. Click **"Yes, Cancel"**
4. Distribution is deleted

**What happens next?**
- Distribution job is removed from queue
- Status changes to **"Draft"**
- You can reschedule distribution later ("Prepare Distribution")

**Restriction:**
- Cancellation only possible up to **5 minutes before send time**
- After that, distribution is already in send process and cannot be stopped

## Automatic Reminders

CeleroPress sends you notifications before scheduled distribution:

### 24 Hours Before

```
Reminder: Scheduled distribution tomorrow

Your press release "[Title]" will be sent tomorrow at 10:00 AM
to 142 recipients.

[View Distribution]  [Cancel]
```

- **Email**: You receive an email notification
- **In-App**: Push notification in CeleroPress dashboard

### 30 Minutes Before

```
Distribution starts in 30 minutes

"[Title]" will be sent at 10:00 AM.
Last chance to cancel.

[View Distribution]  [Cancel Now]
```

### 5 Minutes Before (Final Warning)

```
‚ö†Ô∏è Distribution starts in 5 minutes!

"[Title]" will be sent shortly to 142 recipients.
Cancellation no longer possible.
```

**Disable Notifications:**

Go to **Settings ‚Üí Notifications** and disable:
- ‚òê "Reminders for scheduled distributions"

## What Happens at Send Time?

### 10:00 AM (Send Time)

1. **Distribution job executes**:
   - Emails are generated (personalization)
   - Recipient list is finalized (duplicates removed, unsubscribes filtered)
   - Tracking pixel and links are prepared

2. **Emails are sent**:
   - Rate limiting: 10-20 emails per second
   - For 142 recipients: approx. 7-14 seconds distribution time

3. **Status updates**:
   - Status changes from **"Scheduled"** ‚Üí **"Running"** ‚Üí **"Completed"**
   - You receive notification: "Distribution successfully completed"

4. **Monitoring activated**:
   - Open and click tracking starts
   - First metrics visible within 1-2 hours

**You do NOT need to be online!**

Distribution happens fully automatically, even if:
- You're offline
- Your computer is turned off
- You're on vacation

CeleroPress handles the complete distribution process.

## Multiple Scheduled Distributions

You can schedule **multiple press releases** in coordinated timing:

### Example: Product Launch Campaign

**Day 1 (Monday, 08:00 AM):**
- Press Release 1: "Teaser ‚Äì Big announcement on Wednesday"
- Recipients: Tier-1 media (leading outlets)

**Day 3 (Wednesday, 09:00 AM):**
- Press Release 2: "Product announcement ‚Äì [Product] now available"
- Recipients: All media (leading + regional + blogs)

**Day 7 (Monday, 02:00 PM):**
- Press Release 3: "Follow-up ‚Äì First reactions and testimonials"
- Recipients: Media that opened the first release

**Overview:**

Under **Projects ‚Üí Scheduled Distributions** you see all scheduled distributions:

```
üìÖ Scheduled Distributions (3)

1. "Teaser" ‚Üí 01/13/2026, 08:00 AM (in 5 days)
```

## Common Mistakes to Avoid

### Problem: "Distribution was not sent at scheduled time"

**Possible Causes:**

1. **Server Maintenance**: Scheduled between 02:00-04:00 AM (rare)
2. **Account Issue**: Subscription expired, payment problem
3. **Distribution manually canceled**: Someone canceled distribution before time

**Solution:**
- Check distribution status under **Monitoring**
- Contact support for technical issues
- Check your subscription under **Settings ‚Üí Billing**

### Problem: "Cannot edit scheduled distribution anymore"

**Cause:**
- You're less than 5 minutes before send time
- Distribution is already "locked" and in send process

**Solution:**
- **Cancel**: Click "Cancel Distribution" as quickly as possible
- **Too Late**: If already sent, you cannot stop distribution

### Problem: "Time zone is incorrect"

**Symptom:**
- Distribution occurs at wrong time (e.g., 1 hour shifted)

**Cause:**
- Your account timezone is configured incorrectly
- Daylight saving time change

**Solution:**
1. Go to **Settings ‚Üí Account ‚Üí Profile**
2. Check timezone setting
3. Change if necessary (e.g., "America/New_York" for EST/EDT)
4. **Important**: Already scheduled distributions are NOT automatically adjusted

### Problem: "Scheduled distribution disappears after project edit"

**Cause:**
- Scheduled distributions remain even if you edit the press release
- **But**: If you change the recipient list, distribution is NOT automatically updated

**Solution:**
- After changing recipient list: Cancel old distribution and reschedule
- CeleroPress warns you if you make changes to a scheduled release

## Best Practices

### Tip 1: Optimal Send Times for B2B PR

**Best Days:**
- üü¢ **Tuesday**: Excellent (highest open rates)
- üü¢ **Wednesday**: Excellent
- üü¢ **Thursday**: Good
- üü° **Monday**: Ok (but not before 10:00 AM)
- üî¥ **Friday**: Poor (low open rates)
- üî¥ **Weekend**: Very poor (not recommended)

**Best Times:**
- üü¢ **09:00-11:00 AM**: Excellent (journalists check emails)
- üü° **02:00-04:00 PM**: Ok (after lunch break)
- üî¥ **07:00-08:00 AM**: Poor (too early)
- üî¥ **05:00-08:00 PM**: Poor (end of workday)

### Tip 2: Consider International Contacts

**Problem**: You have contacts in different time zones (e.g., USA, Asia)

**Solution 1: Multiple scheduled distributions**
- Create separate distribution lists per timezone
- Schedule separate distributions for each timezone

**Example:**
- **Europe**: Tuesday, 10:00 AM CET
- **USA (East Coast)**: Tuesday, 10:00 AM EST (= 04:00 PM CET)
- **Asia**: Wednesday, 10:00 AM JST (= Tuesday 02:00 AM CET)

**Solution 2: Compromise time**
- Choose a time acceptable for most recipients
- Example: 02:00 PM CET = 08:00 AM EST (morning USA, afternoon Europe)

### Tip 3: Comply with Embargo Deadlines

**Scenario**: Client has embargo until January 15, 10:00 AM

**Approach:**
1. Schedule distribution exactly for **January 15, 10:00 AM**
2. Add in subject: "Embargo: 01/15/2026, 10:00 AM"
3. Mention in first paragraph: "This information is under embargo until 01/15/2026, 10:00 AM."
4. Send 1-2 days **before** embargo (e.g., January 13)
5. Journalists can prepare articles and publish on time

**Advantage:**
- Journalists have time for research
- Better chances for comprehensive coverage
- Punctual publication guaranteed

### Tip 4: Test Distribution Before Scheduled Send

**Best Practice:**

1. **24-48 hours before**:
   - Send test email to yourself
   - Check formatting, links, attachments
   - Send to test distribution list (5-10 trusted contacts)

2. **Get feedback**:
   - Ask test recipients for feedback
   - Adjust subject/content if needed

3. **Update scheduled distribution**:
   - Edit the press release
   - Scheduled distribution automatically uses latest version

### Tip 5: Maintain Distribution Calendar

**Why?**
- Overview of all scheduled distributions
- Avoid overlaps (e.g., two releases on same day)
- Coordination with other marketing activities

**Tools:**
- Google Calendar/Outlook with reminders
- **Or**: Use CeleroPress **"Scheduled Distributions"** view

## Legal Notes

### Embargo Periods

**Legally Binding?**
- Embargos are **not legally binding contracts**
- Journalists can ignore embargos (ethically not recommended)

**Best Practice:**
- Set embargos clearly in subject and text
- Only send to trusted media
- For sensitive topics: Use NDAs (Non-Disclosure Agreements)

### GDPR Note

- Scheduled distributions are subject to same GDPR rules as immediate send
- Recipient data is stored encrypted
- Opt-outs are automatically considered (even if between scheduling and sending)

## Keyboard Shortcuts

- **Ctrl/Cmd + P**: Schedule distribution (in preview step)
- **Esc**: Close calendar modal
